definition: -ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: And Live alone in the bee-loud glade.
sentences.chinese: 遗世独立于那片蜂儿高鸣的林间野地。

sentences.english: The field is white and the wooded edges dark with evergreen.
sentences.chinese: 野地上银白一片，远处围绕着暗绿色的常绿树木。

sentences.english: He went to an open wild and dug himself a grave.
sentences.chinese: 他来到一片空旷的野地里，给自己挖了一个坟。

sentences.english: They camped in the open and lived on wild plants .
sentences.chinese: 他们在野地露宿，靠吃野莱生活。

sentences.english: And as she floated on, the little wild birds sang round her, and on the banks the little wild harebells bowed to her.
sentences.chinese: 小鸟围绕着她唱歌，岸边野地里的蓝铃花也向她鞠躬。

sentences.english: They give water to all the beasts of the field; the wild donkeys quench their thirst.
sentences.chinese: 使野地的走兽有水喝，野驴得解其渴。

sentences.english: The guerrillas camped in the open and lived on wild plants.
sentences.chinese: 游击队员在野地露宿，靠吃野菜生活。

sentences.english: How far into the wild do you have to go to see wild orangutans ?
sentences.chinese: 要深入野地多远。才能看到野生红毛猩猩？

sentences.english: Consider the lilies of the field, how they grow.
sentences.chinese: 看那野地的百合如何生长。

sentences.english: And as she floated on, the little wild birds sang round her, on the banks the little wild harebells bowed to her.
sentences.chinese: 小鸟围绕着她唱歌，岸边野地里的蓝铃花也向她鞠躬。

definition: dark and uninhabited (idiom); remote and deserted/God-forsaken
Shulin city in New Taipei City 新北市[Xin1 bei3 shi4], Taiwan
